Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: diacriticSensitive
Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Whether the comparison operation is diacritic sensitive

Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: locale
Structs/CollatorOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The locale argument specifies the IETF language tag of the locale to use.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: locale
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Specifies the locale to use, as a BCP 47 language tag.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: currency
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Specifies an ISO 4217 code to use for currency-style formatting.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: minFractionDigits
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Minimum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.name: maxFractionDigits
Structs/NumberFormatOptions.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Maximum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: fontScale
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Applies a scaling factor on text-size as specified by the root layout property.

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: textFont
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Overrides the font stack specified by the root layout property

Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: textColor
Structs/FormatOptions.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Overrides the color specified by the root paint property.

Structs/StyleTransition.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: delay
Structs/StyleTransition.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Length of time before a transition begins.

Structs/Model.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Model.name: uri
Structs/Model.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Model.abstract: URL to a gltf 3D asset in the application bundle

Structs/Terrain.html#/s:10MapboxMaps7Ter.name: exaggeration
Structs/Terrain.html#/s:10MapboxMaps7Ter.abstract: Exaggerates the elevation of the terrain by multiplying the data from the DEM with this value.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: url
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tiles
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: bounds
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: scheme
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minzoom
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxzoom
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: attribution
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: volatile
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile for zoom - delta in a attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in milliseconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests.

Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/VectorSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: url
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tiles
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: bounds
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minzoom
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxzoom
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: tileSize
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: scheme
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: attribution
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: volatile
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile for zoom - delta in a attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in milliseconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests.

Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/RasterSource.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: url
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: A URL to a TileJSON resource. Supported protocols are http:, https:, and mapbox://<Tileset ID>.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: tiles
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: An array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: bounds
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: An array containing the longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source’s bounding box in the following order: [sw.lng, sw.lat, ne.lng, ne.lat]. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: minzoom
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: maxzoom
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: tileSize
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer. Only configurable for raster layers.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: attribution
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: encoding
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The encoding used by this source. Mapbox Terrain RGB is used by default

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: volatile
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: A setting to determine whether a source’s tiles are cached locally.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile for zoom - delta in a attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: minimumTileUpdateInterval
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Minimum tile update interval in milliseconds, which is used to throttle the tile update network requests.

Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: maxOverscaleFactorForParentTiles
Structs/RasterDemSource.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: When a set of tiles for a current zoom level is being rendered and some of the ideal tiles that cover the screen are not yet loaded, parent tile could be used instead. This might introduce unwanted rendering side-effects, especially for raster tiles that are overscaled multiple times. This property sets the maximum limit for how much a parent tile can be overscaled.

Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: coordinates
Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Corners of image specified in longitude, latitude pairs.

Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/ImageSource.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile for zoom - delta in a attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: data
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: maxzoom
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles (higher means greater detail at high zoom levels).

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: attribution
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: buffer
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: tolerance
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance).

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: clusterRadius
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: clusterMaxZoom
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Max zoom on which to cluster points if clustering is enabled. Defaults to one zoom less than maxzoom (so that last zoom features are not clustered). Clusters are re-evaluated at integer zoom levels so setting clusterMaxZoom to 14 means the clusters will be displayed until z15.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: clusterProperties
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: * An object defining custom properties on the generated clusters if clustering is enabled, aggregating values from clustered points. Has the form `{"property_name": [operator, map_expression]}`. `operator` is any expression function that accepts at least 2 operands (e.g. `"+"` or `"max"`) — it accumulates the property value from clusters/points the cluster contains; `map_expression` produces the value of a single point.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: lineMetrics
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: Whether to calculate line distance metrics. This is required for line layers that specify line-gradient values.

Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.name: prefetchZoomDelta
Structs/GeoJSONSource.html#/s:10MapboxMa.abstract: When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile for zoom - delta in a attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom. The default delta is 4.

Structs/Light.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Light.name: anchor
Structs/Light.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Light.abstract: Whether extruded geometries are lit relative to the map or viewport.

Structs/Light.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Light.name: intensity
Structs/Light.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Light.abstract: Intensity of lighting (on a scale from 0 to 1). Higher numbers will present as more extreme contrast.

Structs/Light.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Light.name: position
Structs/Light.html#/s:10MapboxMaps5Light.abstract: Position of the light source relative to lit (extruded) geometries, in [r radial coordinate, a azimuthal angle, p polar angle] where r indicates the distance from the center of the base of an object to its light, a indicates the position of the light relative to 0° (0° when light.anchor is set to viewport corresponds to the top of the viewport, or 0° when light.anchor is set to map corresponds to due north, and degrees proceed clockwise), and p indicates the height of the light (from 0°, directly above, to 180°, directly below).

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: iconColor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The color of the icon. This can only be used with sdf icons.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: iconHaloBlur
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Fade out the halo towards the outside.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: iconHaloColor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The color of the icon’s halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: iconHaloWidth
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Distance of halo to the icon outline.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: iconOpacity
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: iconTranslate
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Distance that the icon’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: textColor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The color with which the text will be drawn.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: textHaloBlur
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The halo’s fadeout distance towards the outside.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: textHaloColor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The color of the text’s halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: textHaloWidth
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is ¼ of the font-size.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: textOpacity
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The opacity at which the text will be drawn.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: textTranslate
Structs/SymbolLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: visibility
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Whether this layer is displayed.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: init()
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconAllowOverlap
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconAnchor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconIgnorePlacement
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconImage
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconKeepUpright
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconOffset
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of icon-size to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with icon-rotate the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconOptional
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconPadding
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconPitchAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Orientation of icon when map is pitched.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconRotate
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Rotates the icon clockwise.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconRotationAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of icons.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconSize
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by icon-size. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconTextFit
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: iconTextFitPadding
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by icon-text-fit, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: symbolAvoidEdges
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: symbolPlacement
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Label placement relative to its geometry.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: symbolSortKey
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with lower sort keys are drawn and placed first. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is false, features with a lower sort key will have priority during placement. When icon-allow-overlap or text-allow-overlap is set to true, features with a higher sort key will overlap over features with a lower sort key.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: symbolSpacing
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Distance between two symbol anchors.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: symbolZOrder
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use symbol-sort-key.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textAllowOverlap
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textAnchor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textField
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Value to use for a text label. If a plain string is provided, it will be treated as a formatted with default/inherited formatting options.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textFont
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Font stack to use for displaying text.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textIgnorePlacement
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textJustify
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Text justification options.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textKeepUpright
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textLetterSpacing
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Text tracking amount.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textLineHeight
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Text leading value for multi-line text.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textMaxAngle
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Maximum angle change between adjacent characters.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textMaxWidth
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The maximum line width for text wrapping.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textOffset
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with text-variable-anchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x- and y-axis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textOptional
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textPadding
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textPitchAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Orientation of text when map is pitched.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textRadialOffset
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Radial offset of text, in the direction of the symbol’s anchor. Useful in combination with text-variable-anchor, which defaults to using the two-dimensional text-offset if present.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textRotate
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Rotates the text clockwise.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textRotationAlignment
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: In combination with symbol-placement, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textSize
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Font size.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textTransform
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS text-transform property.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textVariableAnchor
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: To increase the chance of placing high-priority labels on the map, you can provide an array of text-anchor locations: the renderer will attempt to place the label at each location, in order, before moving onto the next label. Use text-justify: auto to choose justification based on anchor position. To apply an offset, use the text-radial-offset or the two-dimensional text-offset.

Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: textWritingMode
Structs/SymbolLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. The order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: layout
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: paint
Structs/SymbolLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyAtmosphereColor
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A color used to tweak the main atmospheric scattering coefficients. Using white applies the default coefficients giving the natural blue color to the atmosphere. This color affects how heavily the corresponding wavelength is represented during scattering. The alpha channel describes the density of the atmosphere, with 1 maximum density and 0 no density.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyAtmosphereHaloColor
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A color applied to the atmosphere sun halo. The alpha channel describes how strongly the sun halo is represented in an atmosphere sky layer.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyAtmosphereSun
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Position of the sun center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the sun relative to 0° north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the sun, where 0° is directly above, at zenith, and 90° at the horizon. When this property is ommitted, the sun center is directly inherited from the light position.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyAtmosphereSunIntensity
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Intensity of the sun as a light source in the atmosphere (on a scale from 0 to a 100). Setting higher values will brighten up the sky.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyGradient
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Defines a radial color gradient with which to color the sky. The color values can be interpolated with an expression using sky-radial-progress. The range [0, 1] for the interpolant covers a radial distance (in degrees) of [0, sky-gradient-radius] centered at the position specified by sky-gradient-center.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyGradientCenter
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Position of the gradient center [a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]. The azimuthal angle indicates the position of the gradient center relative to 0° north, where degrees proceed clockwise. The polar angle indicates the height of the gradient center, where 0° is directly above, at zenith, and 90° at the horizon.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyGradientRadius
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: The angular distance (measured in degrees) from sky-gradient-center up to which the gradient extends. A value of 180 causes the gradient to wrap around to the opposite direction from sky-gradient-center.

Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: skyOpacity
Structs/SkyLayer/Paint.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: The opacity of the entire sky layer.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8Sk.name: layout
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8Sk.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/SkyLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8Sk.name: paint
Structs/SkyLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps8Sk.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterBrightnessMax
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the maximum brightness.

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterBrightnessMin
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the minimum brightness.

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterContrast
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Increase or reduce the contrast of the image.

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterFadeDuration
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Fade duration when a new tile is added.

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterOpacity
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The opacity at which the image will be drawn.

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterResampling
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The resampling/interpolation method to use for overscaling, also known as texture magnification filter

Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: rasterSaturation
Structs/RasterLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Increase or reduce the saturation of the image.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: layout
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/RasterLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: paint
Structs/RasterLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/ModelLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: modelRotation
Structs/ModelLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The rotation of the model in euler angles [lon, lat, z].

Structs/ModelLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: modelTranslation
Structs/ModelLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The translation of the model [lon, lat, z]

Structs/ModelLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: layout
Structs/ModelLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/ModelLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: paint
Structs/ModelLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: init()
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: accuracyRadius
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The accuracy, in meters, of the position source used to retrieve the position of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: accuracyRadiusTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for accuracyRadius.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: accuracyRadiusBorderColor
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The color for drawing the accuracy radius border. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: accuracyRadiusBorderColorTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for accuracyRadiusBorderColor.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: accuracyRadiusColor
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The color for drawing the accuracy radius, as a circle. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: accuracyRadiusColorTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for accuracyRadiusColor.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: bearing
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The bearing of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: bearingImageSize
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The size of the bearing image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: bearingImageSizeTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for bearingImageSize.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: emphasisCircleColor
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The color of the circle emphasizing the indicator. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: emphasisCircleColorTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for emphasisCircleColor.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: emphasisCircleRadius
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The radius, in pixel, of the circle emphasizing the indicator, drawn between the accuracy radius and the indicator shadow.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: emphasisCircleRadiusTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for emphasisCircleRadius.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: imagePitchDisplacement
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The displacement off the center of the top image and the shadow image when the pitch of the map is greater than 0. This helps producing a three-dimensional appearence.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: location
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: An array of [latitude, longitude, altitude] position of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: locationTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for location.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: perspectiveCompensation
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The amount of the perspective compensation, between 0 and 1. A value of 1 produces a location indicator of constant width across the screen. A value of 0 makes it scale naturally according to the viewing projection.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: shadowImageSize
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The size of the shadow image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: shadowImageSizeTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for shadowImageSize.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: topImageSize
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The size of the top image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: topImageSizeTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Transition options for topImageSize.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: bearingTransition
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: The bearing transition of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Layout.ht.name: bearingImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Layout.ht.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use as the middle of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Layout.ht.name: shadowImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Layout.ht.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use as the background of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Layout.ht.name: topImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Layout.ht.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use as the top of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/s:1.name: layout
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/s:1.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/s:1.name: paint
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer.html#/s:1.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.name: Paint
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayer/Paint.htm.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineBlur
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Blur applied to the line, in pixels.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineColor
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color with which the line will be drawn.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineDasharray
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with lineMetrics: true specified won’t render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineGapWidth
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Draws a line casing outside of a line’s actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineGradient
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Defines a gradient with which to color a line feature. Can only be used with GeoJSON sources that specify "lineMetrics": true.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineOffset
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The line’s offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineOpacity
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The opacity at which the line will be drawn.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: linePattern
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: lineTranslate
Structs/LineLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/LineLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: lineMiterLimit
Structs/LineLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles.

Structs/LineLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: lineRoundLimit
Structs/LineLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles.

Structs/LineLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: lineSortKey
Structs/LineLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: layout
Structs/LineLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/LineLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.name: paint
Structs/LineLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9L.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.name: hillshadeAccentColor
Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.abstract: The shading color used to accentuate rugged terrain like sharp cliffs and gorges.

Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.name: hillshadeHighlightColor
Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.abstract: The shading color of areas that faces towards the light source.

Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.name: hillshadeIlluminationAnchor
Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.abstract: Direction of light source when map is rotated.

Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.name: hillshadeIlluminationDirection
Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.abstract: The direction of the light source used to generate the hillshading with 0 as the top of the viewport if hillshade-illumination-anchor is set to viewport and due north if hillshade-illumination-anchor is set to map.

Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.name: hillshadeShadowColor
Structs/HillshadeLayer/Paint.html#/s:10M.abstract: The shading color of areas that face away from the light source.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: layout
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: paint
Structs/HillshadeLayer.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.name: heatmapColor
Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Defines the color of each pixel based on its density value in a heatmap. Should be an expression that uses ["heatmap-density"] as input.

Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.name: heatmapIntensity
Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Similar to heatmap-weight but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level.

Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.name: heatmapOpacity
Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.abstract: The global opacity at which the heatmap layer will be drawn.

Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.name: heatmapRadius
Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed.

Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.name: heatmapWeight
Structs/HeatmapLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Map.abstract: A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: layout
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMap.name: paint
Structs/HeatmapLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMap.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: fillAntialias
Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased.

Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: fillColor
Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as rgba with an alpha component and the color’s opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used.

Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: fillOpacity
Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the fill-color, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used.

Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: fillOutlineColor
Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of fill-color if unspecified.

Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: fillPattern
Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: fillTranslate
Structs/FillLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/FillLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: fillSortKey
Structs/FillLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: layout
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.name: paint
Structs/FillLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps9F.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionBase
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: The height with which to extrude the base of this layer. Must be less than or equal to fill-extrusion-height.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionColor
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: The base color of the extruded fill. The extrusion’s surfaces will be shaded differently based on this color in combination with the root light settings. If this color is specified as rgba with an alpha component, the alpha component will be ignored; use fill-extrusion-opacity to set layer opacity.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionHeight
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: The height with which to extrude this layer.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionOpacity
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: The opacity of the entire fill extrusion layer. This is rendered on a per-layer, not per-feature, basis, and data-driven styling is not available.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionPattern
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing images on extruded fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionTranslate
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up (on the flat plane), respectively.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.name: fillExtrusionVerticalGradient
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer/Paint.html#/s.abstract: Whether to apply a vertical gradient to the sides of a fill-extrusion layer. If true, sides will be shaded slightly darker farther down.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: layout
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.name: paint
Structs/FillExtrusionLayer.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: circleBlur
Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity.

Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: circleOpacity
Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The opacity at which the circle will be drawn.

Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: circlePitchAlignment
Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Orientation of circle when map is pitched.

Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: circlePitchScale
Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched.

Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: circleStrokeWidth
Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The width of the circle’s stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the circle-radius.

Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.name: circleTranslate
Structs/CircleLayer/Paint.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The geometry’s offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively.

Structs/CircleLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.name: circleSortKey
Structs/CircleLayer/Layout.html#/s:10Map.abstract: Sorts features in ascending order based on this value. Features with a higher sort key will appear above features with a lower sort key.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: layout
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.name: paint
Structs/CircleLayer.html#/s:10MapboxMaps.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/BackgroundLayer/Paint.html#/s:10.name: backgroundColor
Structs/BackgroundLayer/Paint.html#/s:10.abstract: The color with which the background will be drawn.

Structs/BackgroundLayer/Paint.html#/s:10.name: backgroundOpacity
Structs/BackgroundLayer/Paint.html#/s:10.abstract: The opacity at which the background will be drawn.

Structs/BackgroundLayer/Paint.html#/s:10.name: backgroundPattern
Structs/BackgroundLayer/Paint.html#/s:10.abstract: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, …, 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: layout
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Layer layout properties are applied early in the rendering process and define how data for that layer is passed to the GPU.

Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: paint
Structs/BackgroundLayer.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Changes to a paint property are cheap and happen synchronously.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: subtract
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: For two inputs, returns the result of subtracting the second input from the first. For a single input, returns the result of subtracting it from 0.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: not
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Logical negation. Returns true if the input is false, and false if the input is true.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: neq
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the input values are not equal, false otherwise. The comparison is strictly typed: values of different runtime types are always considered unequal. Cases where the types are known to be different at parse time are considered invalid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: product
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the product of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: division
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the result of floating point division of the first input by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: mod
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the remainder after integer division of the first input by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: pow
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the result of raising the first input to the power specified by the second.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: sum
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the sum of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: lt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is strictly less than the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: lte
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is less than or equal to the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: eq
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the input values are equal, false otherwise. The comparison is strictly typed: values of different runtime types are always considered unequal. Cases where the types are known to be different at parse time are considered invalid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: gt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is strictly greater than the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: gte
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second, false otherwise. The arguments are required to be either both strings or both numbers; if during evaluation they are not, expression evaluation produces an error. Cases where this constraint is known not to hold at parse time are considered in valid and will produce a parse error. Accepts an optional collator argument to control locale-dependent string comparisons.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: abs
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the absolute value of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: accumulated
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the value of a cluster property accumulated so far. Can only be used in the clusterProperties option of a clustered GeoJSON source.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: acos
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the arccosine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: all
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if all the inputs are true, false otherwise. The inputs are evaluated in order, and evaluation is short-circuiting: once an input expression evaluates to false, the result is false and no further input expressions are evaluated.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: any
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if any of the inputs are true, false otherwise. The inputs are evaluated in order, and evaluation is short-circuiting: once an input expression evaluates to true, the result is true and no further input expressions are evaluated.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: array
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input is an array (optionally with a specific item type and length). If, when the input expression is evaluated, it is not of the asserted type, then this assertion will cause the whole expression to be aborted.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: asin
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the arcsine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: at
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves an item from an array.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: atan
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the arctangent of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: boolean
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a boolean. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a boolean is obtained. If none of the inputs are booleans, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: switchCase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Selects the first output whose corresponding test condition evaluates to true, or the fallback value otherwise.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: ceil
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: coalesce
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Evaluates each expression in turn until the first non-null value is obtained, and returns that value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: collator
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a collator for use in locale-dependent comparison operations. The case-sensitive and diacritic-sensitive options default to false. The locale argument specifies the IETF language tag of the locale to use. If none is provided, the default locale is used. If the requested locale is not available, the collator will use a system-defined fallback locale. Use resolved-locale to test the results of locale fallback behavior.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: concat
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a string consisting of the concatenation of the inputs. Each input is converted to a string as if by to-string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: cos
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the cosine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: distance
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the shortest distance in meters between the evaluated feature and the input geometry. The input value can be a valid GeoJSON of type Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon, Feature, or FeatureCollection. Distance values returned may vary in precision due to loss in precision from encoding geometries, particularly below zoom level 13.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: downcase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the input string converted to lowercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: e
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the mathematical constant e.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: featureState
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves a property value from the current feature’s state. Returns null if the requested property is not present on the feature’s state. A feature’s state is not part of the GeoJSON or vector tile data, and must be set programmatically on each feature. Features are identified by their id attribute, which must be an integer or a string that can be cast to an integer. Note that [“feature-state”] can only be used with paint properties that support data-driven styling.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: floor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: format
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: *  Returns a `formatted` string for displaying mixed-format text in the `text-field` property. The input may contain a string literal or expression, including an [`'image'`](#types-image) expression. Strings may be followed by a style override object that supports the following properties:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: geometryType
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the feature’s geometry type: Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: get
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Retrieves a property value from the current feature’s properties, or from another object if a second argument is provided. Returns null if the requested property is missing.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: has
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Tests for the presence of an property value in the current feature’s properties, or from another object if a second argument is provided.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: heatmapDensity
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the kernel density estimation of a pixel in a heatmap layer, which is a relative measure of how many data points are crowded around a particular pixel. Can only be used in the heatmap-color property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: id
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the feature’s id, if it has one.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: image
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns an image type for use in icon-image, *-pattern entries and as a section in the format expression. If set, the image argument will check that the requested image exists in the style and will return either the resolved image name or null, depending on whether or not the image is currently in the style. This validation process is synchronous and requires the image to have been added to the style before requesting it in the image argument.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: inExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Determines whether an item exists in an array or a substring exists in a string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: interpolate
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: *  Produces continuous, smooth results by interpolating between pairs of input and output values ("stops"). The `input` may be any numeric expression (e.g., `["get", "population"]`). Stop inputs must be numeric literals in strictly ascending order. The output type must be `number`, `array<number>`, or `color`.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: isSupportedScript
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns true if the input string is expected to render legibly. Returns false if the input string contains sections that cannot be rendered without potential loss of meaning (e.g. Indic scripts that require complex text shaping, or right-to-left scripts if the the mapbox-gl-rtl-text plugin is not in use in Mapbox GL JS).

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: length
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the length of an array or string.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: letExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Binds expressions to named variables, which can then be referenced in the result expression using [“var”, “variable_name”].

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: lineProgress
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the progress along a gradient line. Can only be used in the line-gradient property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: literal
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Provides a literal array or object value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: ln
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the natural logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: ln2
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns mathematical constant ln(2).

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: log10
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the base-ten logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: log2
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the base-two logarithm of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: match
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: *  Selects the output whose label value matches the input value, or the fallback value if no match is found. The input can be any expression (e.g. `["get", "building_type"]`). Each label must be either:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: max
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the maximum value of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: min
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the minimum value of the inputs.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: number
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a number. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a number is obtained. If none of the inputs are numbers, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: numberFormat
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input number into a string representation using the providing formatting rules. If set, the locale argument specifies the locale to use, as a BCP 47 language tag. If set, the currency argument specifies an ISO 4217 code to use for currency-style formatting. If set, the min-fraction-digits and max-fraction-digits arguments specify the minimum and maximum number of fractional digits to include.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: objectExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is an object. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until an object is obtained. If none of the inputs are objects, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: pi
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the mathematical constant pi.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: properties
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the feature properties object. Note that in some cases, it may be more efficient to use [“get”, “property_name”] directly.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: resolvedLocale
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the IETF language tag of the locale being used by the provided collator. This can be used to determine the default system locale, or to determine if a requested locale was successfully loaded.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: rgb
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Creates a color value from red, green, and blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component of 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: rgba
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Creates a color value from red, green, blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component which must range between 0 and 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: round
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Rounds the input to the nearest integer. Halfway values are rounded away from zero. For example, ["round", -1.5] evaluates to -2.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: sin
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the sine of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: skyRadialProgress
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the distance of a point on the sky from the sun position. Returns 0 at sun position and 1 when the distance reaches sky-gradient-radius. Can only be used in the sky-gradient property.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: sqrt
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the square root of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: step
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Produces discrete, stepped results by evaluating a piecewise-constant function defined by pairs of input and output values (“stops”). The input may be any numeric expression (e.g., ["get", "population"]). Stop inputs must be numeric literals in strictly ascending order. Returns the output value of the stop just less than the input, or the first output if the input is less than the first stop.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: string
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Asserts that the input value is a string. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until a string is obtained. If none of the inputs are strings, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: tan
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the tangent of the input.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toBoolean
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a boolean. The result is false when then input is an empty string, 0, false, null, or NaN; otherwise it is true.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toColor
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a color. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until the first successful conversion is obtained. If none of the inputs can be converted, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toNumber
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a number, if possible. If the input is null or false, the result is 0. If the input is true, the result is 1. If the input is a string, it is converted to a number as specified by the “ToNumber Applied to the String Type” algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If multiple values are provided, each one is evaluated in order until the first successful conversion is obtained. If none of the inputs can be converted, the expression is an error.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toRgba
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a four-element array containing the input color’s red, green, blue, and alpha components, in that order.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: toString
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Converts the input value to a string. If the input is null, the result is "". If the input is a boolean, the result is "true" or "false". If the input is a number, it is converted to a string as specified by the “NumberToString” algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If the input is a color, it is converted to a string of the form "rgba(r,g,b,a)", where r, g, and b are numerals ranging from 0 to 255, and a ranges from 0 to 1. Otherwise, the input is converted to a string in the format specified by the JSON.stringify function of the ECMAScript Language Specification.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: typeofExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns a string describing the type of the given value.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: upcase
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Returns the input string converted to uppercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: varExpression
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: References variable bound using “let”.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: within
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: *  Returns `true` if the evaluated feature is fully contained inside a boundary of the input geometry, `false` otherwise. The input value can be a valid GeoJSON of type `Polygon`, `MultiPolygon`, `Feature`, or `FeatureCollection`. Supported features for evaluation:

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: zoom
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Gets the current zoom level. Note that in style layout and paint properties, [“zoom”] may only appear as the input to a top-level “step” or “interpolate” expression.

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: linear
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: exponential
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: cubicBezier
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.name: expressionElements
Structs/Expression/Operator.html#/s:10Ma.abstract: Undocumented

Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: elements
Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: The individual elements of the expression in an array

Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: init(from:)
Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: Attempts to create an Expression from a jsonObject.

Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.name: jsonObject()
Structs/Expression.html#/s:10MapboxMaps1.abstract: Returns a jsonObject representation of this expression if serialization is successful, throws otherwise

Structs/Expression/Element.html.name: Element
Structs/Expression/Element.html.abstract: An ExpressionElement can be either a op (associated with a String)

Structs/Expression/Argument.html.name: Argument
Structs/Expression/Argument.html.abstract: An ExpressionArgument is either a literal (associated with a double, string, boolean, or null value)

Structs/PuckModelLayerViewModel.html#/s:.name: model
Structs/PuckModelLayerViewModel.html#/s:.abstract: The model to use as the locaiton puck

Structs/PuckModelLayerViewModel.html#/s:.name: modelRotation
Structs/PuckModelLayerViewModel.html#/s:.abstract: The rotation of the model in euler angles [lon, lat, z].

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..name: topImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..abstract: Image to use as the top of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..name: bearingImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..abstract: Image to use as the middle of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..name: shadowImage
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..abstract: Image to use as the background of the location indicator.

Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..name: scale
Structs/LocationIndicatorLayerViewModel..abstract: The size of the images, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.

Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: distanceFilter
Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Specifies the minimum distance (measured in meters) a device must move horizontally

Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: desiredAccuracy
Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Specifies the accuracy of the location data.

Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: activityType
Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Sets the type of user activity associated with the location updates.

Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: showUserLocation
Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Sets if the location manager should show the user location on screen or not

Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.name: locationPuck
Structs/LocationOptions.html#/s:10Mapbox.abstract: Sets the type of backend that should be used for the PuckView

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: zoomEnabled
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the user may zoom the map in and

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: rotateEnabled
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the user may rotate the map,

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: scrollEnabled
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the user may scroll around the map,

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: scrollingMode
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: The scrolling mode the user is allowed to use to interact with the map.

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: pitchEnabled
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the user may change the pitch (tilt) of

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: hapticFeedbackEnabled
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the user will receive haptic feedback

Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: decelerationRate
Structs/GestureOptions.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: A floating-point value that determines the rate of deceleration after the user lifts their finger.

Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: encode(_:)
Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Encodes an instance of the concrete GeoJSONObject type.

Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: decodeKnown(_:)
Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Decodes an instance of the known expected GeoJSON type.

Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: decodeUnknown(_:)
Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Decodes an instance of the unknown concrete type that is expected to conform to GeoJSONObject protocol.

Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.name: dictionaryFrom(_:)
Structs/GeoJSONManager.html#/s:10MapboxM.abstract: Converts a generic object confirming to the GeoJSONObject protocol

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: minimumZoomLevel
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The minimum zoom level at which the map can be shown.

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: maximumZoomLevel
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The maximum zoom level the map can be shown at. If the value of this property is

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: minimumPitch
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The minimum pitch of the map’s camera toward the horizon measured in degrees.

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: maximumPitch
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: The maximum pitch of the map’s camera toward the horizon measured in degrees.

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: animationDuration
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: A time interval that represents the amount of time the camera view is animated for.

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: decelerationRate
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: A floating-point value that determines the rate of deceleration after the user lifts their finger.

Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.name: restrictedCoordinateBounds
Structs/MapCameraOptions.html#/s:10Mapbo.abstract: An optional set of coordinate bounds the camera view is allowed to stay within.

Structs/FlyToInterpolator.html#/s:10Mapb.name: init(from:to:with:size:)
Structs/FlyToInterpolator.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Interpolator object that implements an “optimal path” animation, as detailed in:

Structs/FlyToInterpolator.html#/s:10Mapb.name: coordinate(at:)
Structs/FlyToInterpolator.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: Calculates the coordinate given a fraction in [0,1].

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: type
Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The type of the annotation - in this case, a polygon.

Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.name: title
Structs/PolygonAnnotation.html#/s:10Mapb.abstract: The text string containing the polygon’s title. If the value is defined,
